data.title: Basic Pizza
data.text: Zalat Pizza is a small pizzeria in downtown Plano that offers good, basic pizza.  I can't say anything stood out as different here.  They do have several pizza variations you can order and they are open until 2:00 a.m., which is very late for suburbia!  The staff was friendly enough when I visited, however they do seem to be a bit short staffed.

data.title: Understaffed and unfriendly
data.text: I dined at the Plano location with my husband and a friend. We heard great things about this place, and my expectations must have been too high. Kelly was the server, bartender and food runner all in one. She may have been super busy, but she didn't need to give the attitude and slow service. The food was okay, I probably won't go back since urban crust is next door and you'll get better food and service.

data.title: Not to be missed!
data.text: First time customers and we are coming back as fast as we can! We ordered the Meatza and it was delicious!! The crust is amazing, thin and chewy. Perfect amount of sauce and the toppings were plentiful and soooo good, especially the bacon!! Can't wait to try more!! The staff is laid back and friendly. Great, hip location in the heart of old downtown Plano.

data.title: It was okay
data.text: I didn't see what all the fuss was about. I ordered a 18" Zealot pizza. It was the typical New York crust. Nothing was really wrong with pizza that I could complain about, but nothing was great. I wouldn't go back or even tell a friend about it because it wasn't special enough. I probably could find the same quality pizza at any other New York style pizzeria. But if you do find yourself there try it out and judge for yourselves.

data.title: How a Pizza should be
data.text: This place is an example of what a pizza restaurant should be.  The service was great, the food excellent, and the atmosphere relaxing.  This place reminded me of the old school pizza joints back when I was a kid, before the big chain pizza places saturated the market.

data.title: New Pizza Restaurant in Plano
data.text:
I saw that Zalat pizza had just opened for business this last week, so I thought I would see what this place was all about. It is in the same building as the now closed Dalat Vietnamese restaurant was in and it has the same owner.
I ordered the Zealot pizza which is Zalat's version of the supreme. They are calling these gourmet pizzas and you will pay a little more for it.......but.....I found it to be really good......I mean .....really very good!!!!!!
This is not thick crust pizza, so if that's what you're looking for I didn't see it on the menu.....but I would still suggest you try it.....I thought it was worth the extra that it cost!
They also have a full bar and they are open late. I will be going back.
